info.name: Inferior medullary velum
info.description: The inferior medullary velum is a very thin membrane that forms part of the roof of the fourth ventricle caudal to the peak of the ventricle.  It contains the choroid plexus of the fourth ventricle.  The foramen of Magendie (medial foramen) is an opening in this structure that allows cerebrospinal fluid to leave the fourth ventricle and enter the subarachnoid space.
info.item: /Gross/Brain stem & Cerebellum/Brain stem/11 Brain stem - mid-sagittal view
